Resolution authorizing the Speaker to file or join amicus briefs on behalf of the Council in the litigation captioned Windsor v. United States, currently on appeal in the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, for the purpose of supporting the plaintiff’s position that section 3 of the Defense of Marriage Act, which defines the terms “marriage” and “spouse” under federal law to mean only heterosexual unions and individuals, is unconstitutional.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MatterName: Supporting the plaintiff’s position that section 3 of the Defense of Marriage Act.

Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item:  
Council Members Halloran and Ignizio.



The following 2 Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item:  
Council Members Ulrich and Vallone, Jr..



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: NYC Congressional Delegation and President Barack Obama to prevent cuts to the Community Services Block Grant Program.

Items.MinutesNote: Editor's Note:  This Recessed Meeting held on June 28, 2012 , is considered the continuation and conclusion of the Stated Meeting that opened on June 13, 2012.  For attendance purposes, thereore, any Council Member who was marked present at either one of these proceedings will be considered present for the Stated Meeting of June 13, 2012.  Though not present on June 13, 2012, Council Member Mendez was present for this Recessed Meeting of June 13, 2012 held on June 28, 2012 and therefore, for attendance pirposes, is considered Present but Not Voting for the Stated Meeting of June 13, 2012.
